abstract.p: James L Dolan's Sagamore holds on to defeat Larry Ellison's Sayonara for line honors as first boat to finish 42nd running of Newport to Bermuda Race (S)

block.p: In a tight duel between the fleet's two marquee ILC maxis, James L. Dolan's Sagamore held on to defeat Larry Ellison's Sayonara for line honors as the first boat to finish the 42nd running of the Newport to Bermuda Race.

Sagamore, with the America's Cup veteran Ken Read aboard, completed the 635-mile course shortly before midnight Monday with an elapsed time of 80 hours 42 minutes 39 seconds. Sayonara was 13 minutes behind. Dolan is the chief executive of Cablevision, which owns Madison Square Garden and the Rangers.

Bob Towse's Blue Yankee and George Coumantaros's Boomerang finished third and fourth. Eric Crawford's Rhodes 41 Restless arrived in Bermuda yesterday to win the Lighthouse Trophy, awarded to the boat posting the fastest corrected time on handicap.
